sub_title: Director and board member dotSPACE, founder The Extremely Useful Company
summary:
I hold a Master of Science in Environmental Policy and Society and have a diploma in Economics. I have 15+ years of relevant experience in strategy, policy and consultancy. Before starting my own company in June 2015 I worked as senior advisor on EU research and innovation policy at the Ministry of Economic Affairs. Before joining the Ministry I worked as proposal and project manager in the space department of public research and technology organisation TNO, as consultant on the development of the coastal zone in Bulgaria and as space technology consultant for a small privately owned company.  This experience has allowed me to develop four complementary services for public and private sector organisations in a range of domains. 

Personal interest: access to finance for business, including crowdfunding for entrepreneurs in developed and developing countries such as KIva.org and MyC4.com.

projects.title: Copernicus Eyes on Earth Roadshows
projects.description: Following a successful bid we were selected by the EC to support the Copernicus digital skills support initiative. We did this by organising roadshows to raise awareness and analyse the education-business skills gap, focusing on entrepreneurial skills (complementary to www.eo4geo.eu). Successful roadshow were held at EUMETSAT in Darmstadt, Germany, the European Centre for Entrepreneurship, Rotterdam, Netherlands and the National Library in Tallinn, Estonia. The last roadshow was converted to an online event (due to Covid-19). Using our interactive and user-driven masterclass, this was of interest particularly to non-space sectors. Interested to find our more? Contact me at linda.van.duivenbode [at] groundstation.space.

contributors.headline: Director and board member dotSPACE, founder The Extremely Useful Company

projects.title: European Innovation Partnership Smart Cities and Communities project support
projects.description:
Under contract to the European Commission DG MOVE, provide technical and financial project support to the action cluster Sustainable Urban Mobility.  The support we provide has two parts:
- collective events; webinars (knowledge transfer) and matchmaking and brokerage. Matchmaking and brokerage are to bring stakeholders together for a very specific purpose, to obtain funding or prepare procurement. This includes replication of mobility solutions developed by the SCC01 Lighthouse projects. 
- tailored support for up to 20 project looking to deploy (or scale/replicate) urban mobility solutions.

contributors.headline: Director and board member dotSPACE, founder The Extremely Useful Company

projects.title: European Space Solutions 2016 - moderator side event
projects.description: European Space Solutions conference 2016, The Hague (NL). EUMETSAT and Mercator-Ocean organized a side-event to demonstrate the value of Copernicus Earth observation data for the marine and maritime sector. The Extremely Useful Company supported the organisers in refining the objectives and moderated the discussion between the presenters, the panel and the participants.

contributors.headline: Director and board member dotSPACE, founder The Extremely Useful Company

projects.title: Towards a Single and Innovative Transport System (SINTRAS), country reports Belgium, the Netherlands and Luxembourg
projects.description: Towards a Single and Innovative Transport System (SINTRAS), commissioned by the EC DG MOVE. Objective is to understand the barriers to a single European transport system and the uptake of innovation, to inform the new EU transport strategy. The Extremely Useful Company was contracted to write the country reports for Belgium, the Netherlands and Luxembourg. They describe the current policy landscape in these three countries, in particular any transport-related research, development and innovation policy and programmes. The study in particular assessed policy and implementation of five focus areas: 1) Connected driving (C-ITS) and automation of transport, and use of automated optimisation of traffic flows; 2) Transformation of infrastructure to address connectivity, resilience, new fuels and energy efficiency; 3) Smart mobility services (including provision and use of data, and urban mobility), freight and logistics; 4) Standardisation and interoperability; 5) Alternative fuels other than electrification.

contributors.headline: Director and board member dotSPACE, founder The Extremely Useful Company

projects.title: NanoData landscape compilation, sector report Environment
projects.description: This project, commissioned by the EC DG Research and Innovation, provides a comprehensive assessment about European and national policies and programmes to support the development and application of nanotechnologies. The objective is to inform future European research and innovation policy and programmes. The project looks at a range of sectors, such as construction, transport, ICT and energy. The Extremely Useful Company was contracted to write the report for the sector environment, which deals with the application of nanotechnologies for and potential impact of nanomaterials in the environment. It describes the landscape of EU policy and programmes in support of nanotechnology for and in the environment, as well as policy and programmes in all member states and internationally. It provides data about funding provided in framework programmes 6 and 7, publications, patents filed, an estimate of the current market for environmental nanotechnology products and forecast for market growth.

contributors.headline: Director and board member dotSPACE, founder The Extremely Useful Company

projects.title: Innovative Enterprise: Financing Ideas from Europe
projects.description:
Conference Innovative Enterprise – Financing Ideas from Europe on 31 March – 1 April 2016, The Hague (NL). The Extremely Useful Company and S.V.P. Sfeerbeheer took a different approach to the standard conference organisation by developing a unique, purpose-built transparent floating pavilion on the pond in the centre of The Hague as its hub (follow the Flickr link for photos). The pavilion was adjacent to the seat of Government and walking distance to iconic locations for parallel sessions such as Sociëteit de Witte and Johan de Witthuis. 

In addition to a particular focus on the instruments launched under Horizon 2020 (InnovFin), also addressed were the interactions between InnovFin, COSME, the European Structural and Investment Funds (ESIF), and the European Fund for Strategic Investments (EFSI), as well as with instruments at national and local level. The event included sessions on alternative finance, such as crowdfunding. 

To increase the impact and usefulness for visitors, we organised the conference to take place in conjunction with TEDxBinnenhof: Ideas from Europe, so that the different communities could mix and meet during the evening reception and walking dinner. To add value, we co-developed the programme in partnership with the CrowdfundingHub, Dutch Incubation Association, InvestHorizon, Eureka InnoVest and Enterprise Europe Network. With the latter, together with Holland Fintech, we organised the first EEN FintechMatch brokerage event. More than 100 speakers and 400 participants participated in the 24 plenary and parallel sessions.

profile_positions.description: After having worked with dotSPACE for the last 2 years I am happy to have joined the Board at the start of 2021. Groundstation.space supports the creation of Earth observation markets by developing innovation projects. My contribution is my knowledge of EU policies and programmes, to allow us to use available instruments and programmes and engage with (European) partners. Projects: Copernicus Eyes on Earth Roadshows (completed), H2020 Waterforce.eu, H2020 SKIES.
profile_positions.title: Director and board member

profile_positions.description:
At The Extremely Useful Company I combine my experience as policy advisor, consultant, proposal and project manager to offer you four services: 

o	Strategy and Policy development,
o	Project, Proposal and Programme management, 
o	Market and Industry survey,
o	Access to EU Funding.

Domain experience: space/high-tech, environment, climate, water, smart cities/mobility, innovation management.
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description: Shared Purpose - Joint Development! www.ideasfrom.eu. The mission of the Sustainable Scale-up Foundation is to accelerate the deployment and scaling of innovation. We currently work on Personalised Medicine, Self Care (eHealth of young people) and Energy storage solutions. We're offering a "marketplace for deals"!
profile_positions.title: Lead Renewable Energy

profile_positions.description: National Contact Point at the Netherlands Enterprise Agency for Horizon 2020 Societal Challenge Climate Action, Environment, Resource Efficiency and Raw Materials; Fast Track to Innovation and Access to Risk Finance. Informed Dutch organisations about upcoming calls, helped participants develop their proposal ideas and identify relevant call topics, reviewed draft proposals. Organised three meetings about the new Horizon 2020 instrument Fast Track to Innovation, aimed at business and focussing particularly on developing their business case.
profile_positions.title: National Contact Point Horizon 2020

profile_positions.company: Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat
profile_positions.description: With my colleagues in the other departments, I develop the list of priorities, set the agenda, organise meetings etc in order to have a successful EU presidency. This includes building a network with Dutch and European stakeholders and other member states, in particular those in the period leading up to and following the Dutch presidency (Jan-Jul 2016). I represent the directorate-general in the High-Level Group on Innovation Policy Management, a European tripartite (industry, government, academia) group to provide the Council and the Commission with recommendations in June 2014.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager directorate-general Entrepreneurship and Innovation for the Dutch EU Presidency

profile_positions.company: Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat
profile_positions.description: Develop EU R&D and innovation strategy on behalf of the ministry of Economic Affairs. Coordinated (2013) the Dutch input to the negotiations for the Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme, in particular the Industrial Leadership and Societal Challenges. Set up the national support infrastructure for Horizon 2020. Represent the ministry in the Horizon 2020 strategic programme committee.
profile_positions.title: Specialist EU R&D and innovation policy

profile_positions.company: Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat
profile_positions.description: Develop national space policy and represent the Netherlands in EU space policy: space policy expert group, GMES committee. Delegate ESA council. Member ESTEC joint consultative committee.
profile_positions.title: Programme manager national and EU space policy

profile_positions.company: Ministerie van Economische Zaken en Klimaat
profile_positions.description:
Directorate-General Enterprise and Innovation, Innovation Department. Policy Advisor European Innovation and Satellite Space policy.
Project manager Innovatie 2.0, using web 2.0 for crowdsourcing & co-creation of innovation policy.
Project team organising the 2008 (Community of Talents) and 2009 (Innovation is Served) Innovation Lectures hosted by the Minister of Economic Affairs (www.innovationlecture.nl).

Lead market initiative; European cluster policy; ITER-NL (nuclear fusion).

profile_positions.description:
Project: Elaboration of a Vision and a Strategy for Integrated Coastal Zone Management in Bulgaria – Dutch-Bulgarian government to government cooperation (2007-2008)
Assist Bulgarian national government in developing a long-term vision (2030) and strategy (2020) for the management of the Black Sea coast in line with the EU Recommendation on Integrated Coastal Zone Management.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Project manager/bid manager in TNO's Space Department. Member of department management team and business development team. Department develops and builds opto-mechanical instruments for Earth observation and Space science missions, as well as attitude control sensors. Responsible for the bid stage from RFP/RFQ up to contract signature. With the business development team discuss the leads. Developed a standardised bid and project management process; introducing a bid/no bid procedure helped manage resources and increased the success rate. Bid manager for a winning bid to the European Space Agency to place sun sensors on first phase Galileo navigation satellites.
Project manager micro digital sun sensor for TU Delft micro-satellite.
profile_positions.title: Project manager/bid manager

profile_positions.description: Technical consultancy, such as market study Galileo satellite navigation system (EC),  study European Earth observation industry and initial cost/benefit framework Global Monitoring for Environment and Security (GMES) system. Evaluation Dutch and Belgian space policy. Assessment of Hadley Centre for climate research (UK).
profile_positions.title: Consultant
